data.text: @brianmoran Great photo of our HQ. Thanks for sharing & for taking part in #MandelaDay activities.

@tomas_dnk Thanks for the post!

@NYCONLY Great photo! Thanks for sharing.
Congrats to winners of the @UNRWA human rights poster competition -- see the posters here: http://t.co/CCojvbbq02
#Syria: @UNESCOchief deplores rising violence, damage to World Heritage sites http://t.co/lyCvhQtg7V
This week Jan Eliasson highlighted role of dialogue to combat intolerance, extremism. See what he said: http://t.co/a1fGKuf2kq
Lives & livelihoods of millions of families are at stake. Revised Humanitarian Appeal asks for &13bn http://t.co/SKbMxxgWHF #Appeal2013
International cooperation in cybersecurity is essential but do we need a global framework? @ITU blog: http://t.co/WWqoMyb11f
New from @UNGlobalPulse this week: introductory guide to #BigData for Development http://t.co/b3Vih54Vvo #globaldev #BD4D
A year ago @Beyonce recorded this video at the UN -- now it is nominated for an @MTV #VMA for its social message http://t.co/RknWiLJILU
Protecting children begins w/birth certificates! Last yr @UNICEF helped 29.5m babies in 82 countries get one http://t.co/pTmMnmbPgM
#Syria: Latest #humanitarian snapshot shows the impact conflict is having in the region [available in EN & AR] http://t.co/WOT9odPOKa
Cartooning for Peace - this @UNinBrussels video features the work of cartoonists inspired by @NelsonMandela.  http://t.co/E1rWoNzqTX
#Egypt: @UNrightswire requested detailed info from Egyptian Ambassador abt detentions & wants to deploy team: http://t.co/4SkkWaA6et
Veteran journalists, UN deputy chief urge Security Council to do more to protect reporters http://t.co/m7qzQLaSus  #pressfreedom
Ban Ki-moon welcomes new efforts to resume Israeli-Palestinian peace talks http://t.co/qEhuTwXp7O #middleeast
Stevie Wonder: Let's get #UN Disabilities Convention signed, sealed & delivered by all countries. Video: http://t.co/0IlV32Asxf #thisability
Special rep for @childreninwar visited Syria, Jordan, Iraq, Turkey & Lebanon to see impact of conflict http://t.co/IKFy9SpJOD  @UN
Infographic from @UNOCHA: response to inter-communal violence in #SouthSudan, which has left +100k affected http://t.co/7DMKfn1pzE

Join us in welcoming UN Police Adviser Stefan Feller to Twitter. Follow him here: @UNPOL. Info: http://t.co/YIfzvIeV6Y #FF
Snapshot from @OCHA_Syria summarizes the humanitarian situation in Syria http://t.co/j5CzMBO20O #Aid4Syria #map
The UN celebrated Nelson Mandela's 95th birthday this week, honouring his dedication to public service. Video: http://t.co/mdn8WKChZW
#GuineaBissau: Impunity still a major challenge, but @UNrightswire willing to help. Overview from recent visit: http://t.co/H2nOJXWrjT
New: @UNrightswire calls for submission of info & docs on situation of #humanrights in #NorthKorea: http://t.co/8a6zMmwHJl #COIDPRK
Watch Thursday's #MandelaDay event in NYC honouring @NelsonMandela's dedication to service, justice & reconciliation http://t.co/jYuUbTCAGa
In or near NYC? The UN co-produced a film airing on Thursday on @thirteenny for #MandelaDay. Watch now. Details: http://t.co/TwaUiDGlzW
New funds released to support cholera response in Haiti during rainy season http://t.co/nBa9TT2QLG
Check out photos from special #MandelaDay event in NYC with Ban Ki-moon, Bill Clinton, Jesse Jackson & more: http://t.co/bqE0L0c3Ra

Bill Clinton, Jesse Jackson, Harry Belafonte & Andrew Mlangeni to take part in #MandelaDay UN event - watch live: http://t.co/VmWvzCxN25
In addition to your #67minutes of service, take a look at this #MandelaDay photo gallery: http://t.co/bmw3xphTPN
Starts this today in Geneva: general segment of @UNECOSOC -- details here: http://t.co/gOXB3cz5oL
Thursday: @KofiAnnan Dialogue on democracy & elections. http://t.co/SwLlLWSSRd  http://t.co/spFOj2BIoI via @unisgeneva
This week @UN staff joined diplomats from South Africa to spread the word about #MandelaDay in NYC. Photos: http://t.co/61ftVtvVNb
How can you take action & inspire change on #MandelaDay? Ideas are here: http://t.co/jECiWwygyH #67minutes
NYC-based UN staff took on the #MandelaDay #67minutes challenge & rebuilt "Storm Sandy" damaged homes. Photos: http://t.co/nNoXpqHpPo
Thursday is #MandelaDay in honour of his contribution to the culture of peace & freedom. Find out more: http://t.co/jECiWwygyH
During this wk’s #Disabilities Conference, see if your country has ratified the #UN Convention: http://t.co/4RQhxcdWjU #thisability
News from @UNOCHA : 73 million people in 24 countries in need #humanitarian help this year http://t.co/c0e6PeLwXa  #Appeal2013
Starts today in NYC:  Meeting on Convention on Rights of Persons w/ Disabilities http://t.co/zeoe36tN4d #COSP #thisability @UN_enable
Jan Eliasson: "When we help women & girls to reclaim their lives, we & they can & will change the world." http://t.co/Tb0Fdh2fzO
Disabilities Convention sets out countries’ obligations to protect rights of people w/ disabilities: http://t.co/l1D0Zn5YVb #thisability
Murders of journalists in armed conflict are on the rise. Security Council discuss on Wednesday: http://t.co/fX2CgqINhP #pressfreedom
Myanmar: @UNrightswire expert greets abolition of border security force in Rakhine & calls for accountability: http://t.co/tLpWm5kK2M
News: unprecedented $172 million now allocated for neglected emergencies in 2013 http://t.co/fbIN5p3Bu8 via @UNOCHA @UNCERF
We want to see your photos & videos of your #MandelaDay activities. Post them using #67minutes: http://t.co/jECiWwygyH
For first time, EU countries have more people over 65 years of age than under 15 years of age http://t.co/31YuXNtoxo via @who
NOW! Twitter chat w/ Humanitarian Chief @ValerieAmos. Join & share YOUR questions on #humanitarian emergencies using #AskValerie
New #malaria intelligence gathering unit for 10 hardest-hit African countries:   http://t.co/huUXpaFrO9 @ALMA2015 @WHO @RollBackMalaria
Experts to discuss aid innovation & managing risks in emergencies at @UNECOSOC - http://t.co/0Uw4cvcoUW. Watch live + join w/ #HINA.
UNHCR is rushing in aid as 66,000 #Congolese refugees stream into western #Uganda http://t.co/TnDTWJu4vY via @Refugees
Syria Emergency Response Fund has allocated $31.6M for 100 projects in Syria, Iraq, Jordan & Lebanon http://t.co/gLLS8awi7U via @UNOCHA
Fighting forced labor helps women beat poverty -- find out more from @ILONews from chief @GuyRyder http://t.co/lqVWJBT46x #WorkinFreedom
